kimononet.peer

Class PeerAddress

  • java.lang.Object
    • kimononet.peer.PeerAddress
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parcelable

    public class PeerAddress
extends java.lang.Object
implements Parcelable
    The object represents a unique peer address.
    Author:
    Zorayr Khalapyan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ADDRESS_LENGTH
      Peer address length in bytes.
      static int ADDRESS_PADDING_LENGTH
      Current implementation adds a two byte padding to the MAC-48 address in case address space has to increase in the future.
      static java.lang.String BROADCAST_ADDRESS
      Address used for broadcasting packets to multiple peers.
      static int PARCEL_SIZE
      Peer address's parcel size.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PeerAddress()
      Creates a new broadcast address as specified by BROADCAST_ADDRESS.
      PeerAddress(byte[] address)
      Creates a peer address from a byte array representation of a MAC-48 address.
      PeerAddress(Parcel parcel)
      Creates a peer address from the relative PARCEL_SIZE bytes of the provided parcel.
      PeerAddress(java.lang.String address)
      Creates a new peer address from a specified string.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      static PeerAddress generateRandomAddress()
      Securely generates a new random address.
      int getParcelSize()
      Returns the address's parcel's size.
      int hashCode()
      Returns an integer representation of the current peer address.
      void setAddress(java.lang.String address)
      Sets the address of the current peer from the provided address string.
      Parcel toParcel()
      Returns the Parcel representation of the address.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the address.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Sets the address of the current peer from the provided address string. The address string should be 6 two digit values separated by a colon or a dash. For example: 
                address.setAddress("12:00:00:00:00:00);
  
        

        Parameters:
        address - String representation of a peer address.
